climbs.name: They Are Afraid Of Her
climbs.fa: Robbie Freidel and Michael Madsen-- Ground Up summer 2013

content.description: They Are Afraid Of Her was Crazy Horses only daughter, This route is named after her. Start on the diagonaling finger crack which leads to fun and committing face climbing through two bolts. The crack gobbles up gear and has one "interesting section" right before the rest and first bolt. Continue face climbing up and slightly left while getting small gear in diagonal and horizontal cracks. The holds on the wall are sculpted sloper pods and at times can feel insecure. Have a good head and cruise flawlessly through to the next bolt. Above This place a red Camalot and fire off the easy 50ft run out left side of arÃªte to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack. Small gear. 2 bolts. two bolt anchor. Great belay and rap position.
content.location: On Sunday Gulch Rock in the corridor on the west facing wall. Shares a start with Cherry Light but continues left as Cherry Light goes straight up.

climbs.name: Cherry Light
climbs.fa: Robbie Freidel and Michael Madsen --  Ground Up summer 2013

content.description: Variation that starts in the same crack as They Are Afraid Of Her (5.9). Climbs the crack up to the flake. Place a stopper and move straight up and around the flake to gain the low angle chimney. Don't be fooled by this "easy Chimney" its fun 5.6-5.7 that makes ya think in a few spots. Exposure is great and the views half way up the Chimney are good enough to jump on this climb. The chimney gobbles gear good. The last part of the climb is a nice step out onto the flake and is about a 5.7-5.8 move with beautiful exposure. Great belay at top. Take a moment to take a seat at one of the best natural benches in around Sylvan with great views of Vertigo. Downclimb is on the back. The downclimb scramble might be just as fun as the route itself!
content.protection: Standard Needles Rack long slings for rope.

content.description: Sunday Gulch Rock is the giant cracked up rock formation to the right when heading down Sunday Gulch. It looks huge given it is the biggest formation on the right hand side. The climbing here is peaceful and the small creek adds to the echoing walls of the Gulch. You will notice a pink deteriorated sling on The massive and impressive Sahib (5.10)  when first looking at the formation from the guarded trail.
